The pint glass was of little solace

text: What's fucked up is that I am going to college right now, and i can see myself rushing unstoppably into Beef's position.

text: I have already finished college and entered into Beef's position. I have been living it for the past four years. There is no alcohol to seek false solace in, however.

name: ethelthefrog
text: I have to disagree with you on that. strongly. The Beef in my mind has a much nicer voice.

name: rowboat
text: I've always hesitated to get in on all the "this character's voice would be...." hoopla, mainly because I'm scared to death of an animated version of this. If a comic as amazing as The Maakies can be all but ruined in that medium (as it was), I just hate thinking about what it would do to this. I know it's tempting, but some awesome things are better left alone. However, if there ever was such a thing, I don't believe that Jason Alexander would be the answer. It's just one man's opinion, but he may be the farthest thing possible from appropriate, really. If I had to pull one off the top of my head, I think I'd go with Crispin Glover. Hmm. I guess this game is kind of fun.

name: troy_convers
text:
S'true, I was hunting for the right voice for 'Beef, and Jason Alexander fits the bill.
Still on a 'Duckman' tip, how about Gregg (Cornfed Pig) Berger, as the voice of Liebot. How could you not beleive him with a voice like that?

name: gunsofray
text: I would go with the dude who voiced Niko in Grand Theft Auto 4 .. but then i am an uneducated teenager, so that is to be expected.

text: i wouldn't try to say what his voice sounds like, but that is not it for sure.
